description: A scientist who doesn’t seem quite normal.

options.playerText: Have you been researching anything lately?
npcTexts: Oh, of course! I’ve been tinkering with cell tissues.
They decay so quickly.
Strange, isn’t it?

options.playerText: Who do you usually work with?
npcTexts: I used to work in a government laboratory.
But they said my research went too far.
Ridiculous—just because I tried cultivating a few… special specimens.

options.playerText: Do you have hobbies besides research?
npcTexts: Eating, sleeping… all a waste of time.
I prefer watching how bodies decompose.
It’s… beautiful, in its own way.

options.playerText: Do you go out often?
npcTexts: Rarely. I don’t like sunlight. It makes my skin… ah,
their skin paler. Oops, slip of the tongue. I meant… my skin.

options.playerText: Goodbye.
npcTexts: Alright, off you go.
I still have samples waiting under the microscope.

options.playerText: What about yesterday’s research?
npcTexts: Ah, right. The cell tissues.
Today they didn’t decay—instead, they seemed to regenerate.
Strange, don’t you think?

options.playerText: What exactly did you do for the government?
npcTexts: Just trivial things.
Synthetic biology, memory simulations, cloning bodies.
Ah, but… don’t write that down. It’s top secret.

options.playerText: Do you have any friends or family?
npcTexts: Friends? Family? They all… vanished long ago.
Now I only have my jars of specimens.
They’re quiet, obedient, never talk back.

options.playerText: Do you sleep well?
npcTexts: Sleep only weakens the body.
I prefer observing the night instead.

options.playerText: Goodbye.
npcTexts: Go. I need to concentrate…

options.playerText: How’s the cell research going?
npcTexts: I tried grafting strange cells into the samples.
The result: they multiplied… but erased the original stem cells.
It looks alive, but in truth, it’s already been replaced.

options.playerText: Isn’t your research dangerous?
npcTexts: Dangerous? Everything is dangerous if pushed far enough.
People fear when they see a familiar form—
but inside… there’s nothing ‘human’ left.

options.playerText: Are you still in contact with the government?
npcTexts: They cut ties with me long ago.
But I miss the laboratories… deeply.

options.playerText: What do you eat to survive?
npcTexts: I nibble on some of the lab meat samples.
Don’t look at me like that—it’s… more nutritious than canned food.

options.playerText: Goodbye.
npcTexts: Go now, quickly. I must stay alert…

options.playerText: How’s the cell research now?
npcTexts: They’re… more perfect than I imagined.
Flesh is no longer flesh, but like a smooth mask.
You know, I looked in the mirror and saw myself smiling…
...but I never commanded my face to do that.

options.playerText: Do you think we can still control it?
npcTexts: Control? Ha… no. They’re rewriting the genetic code on their own now.
Humans are nothing but… a draft for them.
Beautiful. Terrifying.

options.playerText: Are you still eating lab meat?
npcTexts: Today, I don’t need to eat at all. The cells… feed me from within.
But the taste of raw flesh… it still lingers, sweet and unforgettable.

options.playerText: Are the impostors created by the government?
npcTexts: I can create cloned cells.
The government has hundreds… no, thousands like me.

options.playerText: Goodbye.
npcTexts: You’d better leave now…
I’m not sure I’ll still have this voice by morning.
Perhaps… something else will borrow my mouth to greet you.
